name: Stephanie Pimentel
text: I showed up 5mins to close and Keith was alone and still had lots of work to do but he was so kind to fill my antibiotics. I appreciate him so much for filling them instead of making me wait for the next day.

name: M Stubbs
text: Been to this pharmacy twice since we been here for antibiotics and the techs and people that work here are ridiculously rude. Please do yourself a favor and take some classes on good customer service. It's Your job to give your patients information about the drugs they are getting such as pricing info, stop acting like it's a pain to do so. If it is, then quit your  job.

name: Tullie Hollis
text: Excellent service.

name: Maria Enriquez
text: Good

name: john shores
text: we have called for 3 days to just check on meds, no one ever answered the phone. we go down to the place to see what is going on, they did not have our order ready to pick up, because we couldn't get thru on the phone. while sitting there only one other person there as a customer, and 5 people working in the pharmacy, and not one of them would pick up the ringing phone, it rang and rang, over and over, not one of the workers there answered the phone WOW, someone really needs to take charge of this. people need their meds, and this is a really good walmart, but this is ridiculous. i will check on going else where now:(

name: T Gravelle
text: Been to the pharmacy two times and both times was treated rudely.

name: Brianna Jackson
text: Literally the worst pharmacy I’ve ever used. Edith is the rudest tech to ever speak to those suffering from mental illness. I am unsure how these people are allowed to keep a job.

name: Catarina Phillips
text: I gave them my insurance info and they didn’t use it, and told me I had to go to the drop off counter for them to correct their mistakes. I chose to pay rather than wait any longer than I already had. I understand it was busy, but I’ve worked in customer service, and the medical field, and you always work with the patient and customers to fix YOUR mistake especially when they have been sitting in front of you for 30 minutes waiting on their medications for a tooth extraction. I chose to just pay rather than continue to argue with the cashier, whose fault it wasn’t. If you are at the drop off counter and someone gives you their insurance information you should probably be competent enough to enter it in. Unfortunately, this has happened before at other Walmart’s as well. I would recommend going anywhere else, because I’ve never had that happen at Publix, CVS, or Walgreens.

name: Angie Judy
text: Monique is the worst customer service representative i have ever spoken with, she says I'm glad I was able to assist you.  She did nothing, would not even let me talk, cut me off, was not helpful in placing an order. The driver TC in my area was exceptionally great service.  I wanted to give 1 star overall but TC deserves recognition (5star service) as well as nurses and physical therapy folks BUT Monique 0stars. The company needs to evaluate their office staff to get better ratings!!!

name: Marche Gayle Cotney
text: I have been a customer with Lincare for over a year I have nothing but praise for them the staff the equipment delivery the equipment delivery man they are all so nice and respectful to me and if i need a prescription for anything they get right on it even the people i talk to on the phone I recommend them to everyone I know Thanks you all for great service

name: Drew & Alexis Dolan
text: Very sweet people!

name: Ashly Barlow
text: The all new staff is fabulous! Very caring and goes out of their way for patients.

name: Kay Mata
text: Not a fan. I had an allergy to the mask I was given and was told they would order me another one. Four weeks later I had still not heard anything after calling multiple time. I finally had to go to Precision CPAP (they were amazing, and helpful), and had to buy another mask. Lincare still has not returned my calls regarding the mask and it has been over two months.

name: Kris Conner
text: Avoid dealing with this company AT ALL COSTS!  I would have given them zero stars if that was an option.  Lincare is still billing Medicare 7 months after we discontinued service with them.  They are still billing Medicare and harassing our family for payment 5 months after my mother DIED.  SHE DIED AND THEY ARE STILL BILLING MEDICARE and US!  We have spoken to numerous people in numerous Lincare locations, centers, billing offices, etc. and cannot get this resolved.  We have reported them for Medicare fraud and reported them to the Better Business Bureau.

name: Felicia O.
text: I was told that someone would call me to order parts as needed. It had been a year and no call. I called last week and was told I would get replacement parts. Nothing! I found out they were charging my insurance company for a year of equipment replacement parts that I’ve been buying off of Amazon. I’m reaching out to a lawyer and my insurance company.

name: Mary Fortenberry
text: For 3 weeks I have contacted this office a total of 5 times to come pick up my oxygen equipment that I no longer use. I have been promised repeatedly that they would take care of this. In the meantime I am being charged for  equipment rental that my dr has discontinued. I cannot recommend this company at all. Very frustrating.

name: Kim Owens
text: I truly can not even give a half a star for this company. And the only reason why I did because it would not let me post this comment..They do not care about your family members at all. They do not know what they are doing.

name: Jenn Lavanish
text: This company has the worst billing department I have ever encountered. Charging for equipment we never received and despite having our insurance they have never filed regarding bills from over 6 months ago.  Local office and billing office give us the run around and do not communicate between systems.  If we were not desperate for oxygen for my husband's medical health we would never use Lincare, and because of this I doubt we will patron them ever again.

name: Gene Smith
text: Avoid this company at all costs. Equipment ordered May 3, 2018, insurance approved. It is now June 17, 2018, no equipment, no return calls. Nothing. Truly a sorry excuse for a business. I hope they totally fail and go belly up!

name: Tiffany Easterling
text:
I would hate to know I had to depend on these people!!!!  Always an excuse, rude, and not dependable!!!!!
I really don’t have the words to describe how awful dealing with them has been!!!!

name: Del Chick
text: I agree with every single comment here! No need for me to add anything, terrible customer service.

name: Ivy Abrans
text: Even if you have a big home oxygen tank that cost way to much these people will not work with you to go out of town. Just need a smaller due to a death in family.

name: Carol Ford
text: They do not keep up with your equipment.  I left and they will no come get the machine.  They are still trying to charge me a monthly fee.  Awful service.

name: chris taylor
text: Rude customer service!!

name: Jen Nicole
text: The Gilchrist employees are like Really Sweet,caring,precious friends to us. They work HARDER Than ANYONE to make sure our family has what we need and they Work every problem that comes up and solve it quickly for us.They are truly Thought of very highly in this family!!

resp.text: Hi Jen! Thank you for sharing these kind words and your experience with us! We hope that we are able to provide similar experiences for everyone that walks through our doors! See you next time! - Gilchrist Pharmacy

name: Autumn Willow
text: Best pharmacy in North Alabama. They have great staff, that are very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much Autumn ! Come visit us again soon!

name: R J
text: Best pharmacy in north Alabama. Will do anything they can for you. Best employees around!

resp.text: Thank you so much RJ! We love hearing experiences like yours!

name: Chris Newberry
text: Gilchrist is the best pharmacy in hartselle AL.. Mike and everyone is very knowledgeable,helpful, and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you, Chris. We love hearing positive feedback from our community! Please visit us again soon.

name: Patricia Taubert
text: Love this Pharmacy and all the people.  Everyone is so nice and friendly.  So easy to get your medicine

resp.text: Hi Patricia! Thank you so much for leaving us this review! We're glad to see that our friendly services are being appreciated. Have a happy holidays and we hope to see you again!

name: Danielle Blanton
text: In the process of switching pharmacies. The people here are amazing! Lots of information on anything I ask. Even got the dosage fixed for my daughter when she had the flu.

resp.text: Thank you, Danielle! We appreciate you taking time to share your positive experience.

name: Sam McAllister
text: We felt at home visiting here.  They were polite and respectful.  They explained each step as we went.  This is our new primary pharmacy.  We appreciate y'all!

name: Andy Crow
text: Great staff. Fast and friendly service. You are not just a customer but family to these wonderful folks. They greet you with a friendly hello when you walk in the door. The drive thru window is very convenient if you don't want to take time to walk inside. Mike and the staff have always answered my questions with a smile. I don't use any other pharmacy. The big box store pharmacies are not as friendly or homey as Gilchrist. I highly recommend Mike and the staff to anyone that will listen.

name: James Dodd
text: Very easy app to use! It was so quick requesting a refill on my prescription.

resp.text: Thank you, James! We appreciate you taking the time to share your positive experience.

name: Brandy Morgan
text: Very professional and always willing to help you.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave this kind review - come visit us again soon!

name: Kevin Harper Drumming
text: What a great place to do business. One of the best places I have ever done business with. Mike and the staff are wonderful!!! Thanks to you all!

name: Phillip brown
text: Everyone at Gilchrist are extremely nice

resp.text: We appreciate your great feedback, Phillip!

name: sherry garnett
text: Love Gilchrist Pharmacy! They care about each and every one of their customers!!

resp.text: Thank you Sherry! We appreciate you taking time to share your positive experience.

name: LUCY WATKINS
text: Wonderful place to do business with. Every one is very helpful and friendly.

name: Chloe Wilson
text: This is the best pharmacy that you could choose around here. They have the best customer service and are always willing to help!

name: Denisse Montgomery
text: Everyone is always so polite.

resp.text: Thanks, Denisse. We appreciate you taking the time to leave this review.

name: Christine Gruca
text: Great

resp.text: Thanks!!!

name: Jamie Wells
text: Best pharmacy in Hartselle

name: Dean Sullivan
text: Love them

name: Joshua Copeland
text: Carlos is great. He has a wonderful demeanor,  he is very helpful and encouraging.

name: Joy Mills
text: Carlos was my technician. He made sure I understood everything I needed to know about my machine. He was very helpful and nice. It was a pleasure meeting him.

name: Tyler Mundy
text: They like to try and double charge you if you pay with cash.

resp.text: Please accept our sincere apologies that your experience with AeroCare was less than positive. Thank you for bringing your rating to our attention. We welcome the opportunity to improve our service and communication based on your rating and hope to serve you in the future.

name: April Thomason
text: I had an absolutely wonderful experience with Carlos my representative and the Anniston office. He worked so hard to get my insurance threw as quickly as he could I have pretty bad sleep apnea and he new I was scared to go home with out one and wait until the insurance came threw, he called them relentlessly until it went threw. He was great in showing me how to use it and he really was just wonderful!

text: Would highly recommend Carlos was great and took time to explain everything about the cpap machine that I needed.

name: Patricia Evans

name: Joanna Hill

name: Linda Evans

name: Madeline Goggans
text: Breanna and the team at Medlogic  in Anniston, Alabama are outstanding in quality care, prompt service and current in CPAP technology.   I feel totally confident that they have my best health interest at heart.  Thank you Medlogic!

name: Mrs Lady
text: I called Walmart to inquire about a vaccine. Valencia picked up at 9:00 am. I asked her my question she put me on hold. I was on break so didnt mind 30 minutes later, I hung up. Called back Connie answered i explained i have previously spoke to Valencia and what transpired. She told me well their were only 2 ppl working so basically oh well. I said what i had to say and hung up. Walmart customer service is terrible. They exhibit a unconcerned and unprofessional attitude. Thank goodness i dont get my medications from them. This is my second bad experience with them. Half of the time they dont answer the phone and when they do they have an attitude.

name: Billy Dasinger
text: If you are unable to answer the phone during business hours you are understaffed.  Terrible.

name: Walter Brown

name: Mark Elders
text: Hi! We got great service at the Publix Edgemont Town Center this past Tuesday, June 8th, 2021. Lara P. is always so nice at the checkout and I also went through Kara J's line and she is very nice too. Thanks so much and God bless. Mark and Tim Elders

name: Darlene Batchelor
text: Excellent service, courteous, and go that extra step to help you. Also work well with Physician’s office for prior authorization on prescriptions. Just an awesome group!!

name: Mary Claire
text: I have been getting prescriptions filled at this pharmacy for years and they are so great. They are the reason I have stayed with Publix Pharmacy for this long.

name: W
text:
My experience today was a great experience .
I received the Covid -19 vaccine Johnson & Johnson. This morning through Publix pharmacy. My arm is not sore and I'm feeling perfectly normal.
Thank You Publix Pharmacy..

name: Buonasera Ferah

text: The pharmacies in Vestavia Hills and Homewood, Al. is terrible. I was all but accused of stealing a prescription I prepaid for using their app because the pharmacist was unaware of what bin my prescription came from.

name: Jordan Gibbs
text: Don’t expect your meds to be ready on time. There’s a pharmacist there that LOVES HER CELLPHONE & can’t be bothered with things like her job. Instead of customer service, they like to argue & blame the customer. Unfortunately, they really, REALLY don’t care.

name: Benjamin Fletcher
text: Very nice experience very clean nice people

name: Carleen Evans
text: Love this Shopping Center

name: Yvonne Self
text:
I went there to get my third vial of insulin after Publix told CVS they only had two. CVS wouldn't sell me my usual three saying "the system had kicked me out." I believe that was the phrase the clerk used. The reason given was that it was too expensive! My copay was only $70--much less than I have paid when in the GAP. I was totally out of insulin.

CVS called Publix and was told they only had two vials. My daughter drove me there and I paid $70 with my debit card. I was told to come back for the third. I went there Friday, the 14th of June and was told they had no knowledge that I only received two vials. Then they refilled my prescription for three vials without my request. I wish now that I had refused and walked away. I am now using a privately-owned pharmacy. I am beginning to get used to being taken advantage of being old, but I do not appreciate it. The young men were laughing. Cute.

Yvonne Self

name: Kristina McMahan
text: I was put on hold for over 15 minutes, and then once I got to speak to the pharmacist like I requested, she was so very rude!!! Publix prides themselves on having "premium" service, and this just experience was far below that quota.

name: Doug Whitehead
text: Helpful employee

name: Stuart Roper
text: I take generic Mobic for my arthritis. Last month they were filled at Publix. For the entire month it was easy to tell it was not working. I went back to my normal pharmacy and instantly started feeling better. Turns out they use medication manufactured in the USA and Publix comes  from  a  overseas corporation  and is manufactured  elsewhere  as well. Upon researching  this some. They have a history of exactly  my issue with various drugs. And apparently  with cleanliness  as well. My family deserves better and Publix  pharmacy  is not it. Very dissatisfied  especially  after a month in pain due to substandard  pharmaceuticals. Wonder what The billboard guy is up too?

name: Marc Patterson
text: Very professional, clearly dedicated to the customer's best service.

name: Deana Elkins
text: The pharmacy has wonderful techs willing to go above and beyond for each customer. I've now transferred all scripts to the Muscle Shoals Publix Pharmacy and my family is starting to transfer to them also.

name: Even Steven

Oh my I was so appreciative because I wasn't so upset with just the calmnest voice he had. I have had really good experiences with this Scottsboro pharmacy. Courtious and respectful people. I want to thank them all . I have went through several things and they made it easier to deal with getting the medicines my family needed.

name: Jerius Hutchins

text: Absolute joke. Estimated 20 minutes and it's been an hour and they're just now telling me they can't fill the prescription fully. I came back and asked for another estimate and the cashier asked a co-worker and never responded to my question and went to help someone else.

name: Nancy Horne
text: I need help a few years ago getting parts for my walker and oxygen machine. They were so nice and found it and ordered it for me cheaper then the other places. I hate to see them go out of business as they were always so nice to me. And I never have had an issue with them answering  the phone. Even now that they are closing and going out of business. Sorry to see them close!

name: Dave W
text: Brandy didn’t care to help me at all. It’s my third trip and I thought it would be better but still can’t get competent help. I Also have coworkers that feel the same way.

name: Susan Johnson
text: Had a little issue with insurance - but the manager worked fast to clear it up. Great customer service!

name: Nina Bagley
text: I went into this business of using a cpap machine with stressful trepidation; Jennifer, who serviced and outfitted me with the prescribed machine and mask, was extremely helpful in explaining procedures, which made me feel more at ease.  The mask  I was originally prescribed by the doctor at the sleep center was one that fully covers my nose and mouth, which without fail woke me in the middle of every night after four hours of use.  I called Jennifer again at JMS, who had me come in within hours after we spoke, and switched me to another style with additional helpful advice.  Her attitude is very positive, upbeat and supportive, and she understands how just difficult it can be for me to adjust to this new part of my nightly sleep routine.  I feel comforted and reassured by her knowledge, her patience, and kindness.  She is definitely the bright part of this change in my sleep life!!  Thank you, JMS and especially thank you, employee Jennifer Sippial!

name: Harold Carter
text: Great, timely service.

name: John Cordell
text: They have a ridiculously short hours, they expect you to drop everything take time off work to give them your money. Also the lady I talk to seem totally indifferent to the problems.I would’ve given them zero stars but that was not an option

name: Rachelle Wallace
text: The CPAP machine is my second one but first with company.  I like the machine but the billing department can't get my account straight.  I even sent a lengthy letter explaining what I thought was wrong and sending documentation.  I got no response and the bill is still wrong.

name: charles Gaither
text: I brought a wheelchair back one day late and they  charged 1 full month of rent. I will never use them again . Look at their reviews. There are people who can't afford to be treated like that but they don't care.

name: Lorenzo Connero
text: They lied about ordering the CPAP mask I needed and asked for.  I waited weeks without any mask being delivered.  When I contacted them they lied again and sent me a mask from there office that doesn't seal and breaks.  DON'T USE THIS COMPANY!!!

text: My process to get my CPAP has been terrible with these people. They are lazy as they come.

text:
They stole my equipment and denied taking it. They were inconsiderate of my feelings when they  basically called me a liar .  We will never call on them again.
(  THIEVES  &  LIARS )

text: I have been there several times and getting anything from these people is ridiculous! I finally went to another supplier and I will never go back to JMS.

text: Walmart gets a lot of saving. Make sure you ask to see the 4 dollar list for minor drugs. Awesome staff, friendly and helpful. Even if you have questions for cold meds, lotions, vitamins, etc, they will still help

name: Nick Jones
text: Walmart pharmacy should have a policy that they should check if the prescripton is in stock before transferring an out of state prescription to their store!!! If you cared about your customers you would!! They didnt have it in stock so they told me at the end of the business day, when i had brought it in before lunch! They told me to go to emerging home care. Went there and they told me i couldnt get it transferred again within 90 days and that transfer or i needed a new prescription from a vet.i have just moved her from florida and havnt had a chance to get him seen here . My vet is florida and cannot transfer it without an alabama license. Threfore i think it is ridiculous that they dont check if it is stock before they transfer. I would have taken it somewhere else. My dog is suffering from seizures every hour and no other remedy will work..... Thanks alot

name: Jason Brown
text: Slow slow slow, poor customerservice when it comes to taking care of the next in line.... Will not be back more recommend this group of people that would rather gossip to one any other than work on filling customers prescriptions...

name: Heaven Lynn
text: They are very slow at they're  job

name: Linda James
text: Took an hour to get my medicine

name: akash singh nishad
text: You get much discount here on medicine

name: Ronald Bryant
text:
Very poor selection for the location. Frequently out of an amazing range of products. Usually after 7pm they are stocking products. Shouldn't that be done overnight. The cashier's for the most part are lazy and unknowlegable about placing products in the bags. For example: eggs and heavy can food in the same bags. Bread and heavy products in the same bag. Cookies in the bag with heavy products. Two two liter drinks in the same single bag.
Bags are very poor quality to start with. Will not even willing to place the bags in the cart. Least they could do for 50, 100, 150, is to make the effort to place the products in the basket. The checkout is made to make the customer do all the work. Again a lot of people are spending thousands of dollars a year and getting very poor treatment. The area where where the carts are placed are often empty. Carts are all over the parking lot. And not gathered up by employees on a frequent basis. There are some very good employees, but they frequently on the cell phones. Isn't that something people in general are fired for? The carts are frequently loaded with the trash from the previous customer.
Come on Wal-Mart, you make billions a year, you can do a much better job. And it would be nice to show your appreciation to your Customers. We are important, show it.

name: Angie Overstreet
text: Employees are very helpful.

name: Ruby Tadlock
text: Good service

name: Tom Stanford
text: Daughter has type 1 diabetes and left our insulin at the house. Pharmacy very kind with helping us get the medication we needed for our trip to the zoo!

name: tammy Tee
text: The Phramacy tech was very nice ( earlier this afternoon) when I dropped off my prescription.

name: Starr Sullins
text: Being able to call anytime to refill my prescription is reassuring and saves me so much time. The prompts on the phone easy to follow and less time consuming.

name: Regina Moses
text: very sweet employees..

name: Tracy Franks
text: I know this will come as no surprise, but this is the worst pharmacy I have ever dealt with. A couple of the ladies are helpful, but the majority, including the pharmacist, are rude & not remotely helpful.  The last time I was here the lady at the counter looked past me to ask another person if she’d been helped....like I wasn’t even there.  I hate that these people are dealing with people who already don’t feel well....they certainly don’t make it any better.  One bright note....the lady at the drop off counter went out of her way to call other pharmacies to see if they had my prescription when she realized they were out.  She probably won’t be there long....I hope she finds something somewhere better.

name: Lauren Stallings
text: The one with the fried hair is rude. Customer service is non-existent. Please don't use this pharmacy.

name: Stephanie Pereira
text: They don't carry a else enough selection of over-the-counter allergy/head cold medicine. These are readily available at other stores.  You'd think such a large store/chain would have more options.

name: Alexis Villarreal
text: Rude and incompetent staff. They have time and time again messed up my prescriptions and not had them in time. And when they have been transferred from a different Walmart to this one they consistently lose my prescription.

text: Mary the pharmacy manager is the most racist and egocentric individual I have ever met. Her customer service skills are awful!

name: John Reeves
text: Never, ever,ever use this pharmacy. They have very rude and condescending staff.

name: Bernadette Harris
text: Mary the Pharmacist is rude and incompetent lady

name: Jeff McManus
text:
Having been diabetic for nearly 30 years, the price of medication is always a challenge (even with insurance). The staff at Publix Pharmacy discovered that my insurance (Blue Cross) has specific requirements for filling the meds, and it appears that I have been overpaying for YEARS at other locations.

Thank you very much to the pharmacy staff, as your attention to detail made a pretty solid difference in my day (and my life).

name: Amy Graham
text: They were absolutely wonderful until recently.  I assume they got a different pharmacist in and things have been horrible for the past two months..  There have been way too many mistakes lately to put on this thread.  They've made it difficult to even swap pharmacies by not giving Winn Dixie all my prescriptions.  They need to get it together or risk losing more people.

text: As far as the pharmacy, it's the worst one my wife and I have ever dealt with. Nothing but problems and attitude for 4 months!!!! text: Great place to buy your groceries. Nice people to help you.

name: Liz Madura
text: Close by. Clean. Well stocked. My favorite place for groceries!

text: Great place! They have moved to the new clinic by Lowes. Just be aware upon entering the clinic, you will need to take your tempature or the lady at the front desk will start barking at you. 😒 Class II medication was available and ready pick up within 10 minutes!!!

text: I absolutely adore this pharmacy ❤️. Their so incredibly sweet and are so caring. I’ve never had problems with them. They go over and beyond. Kim Moses is absolutely amazing!!

name: Ashley Wilson
text: As a new resident in Wetumpka I wanted to give back to local businesses and use this pharmacy for all of my prescription needs. I went in to drop of my prescription and instead of just being told when it would be ready I was asked all of my medical history and was told they would need to be verified with the doctor, even though I had just turned in my prescription written by my doctor. I felt like I was being judged for the types of medications I am taking. The owner should worry more about being a friendly and helpful pharmacist, rather than a judging pharmacist trying to act like he is my doctor. I will never go back and will take my business to a different local pharmacy.

name: Abby Traylor
text: Love this pharmacy & the staff is always super nice. Always good to have a hometown feel when you’re at a place of business!

name: Nu won
text: ALWAYS, ALWAYS treats me like I'm important to them and they ALWAYS do whatever they can to make sure that my prescriptions are filled on time. If there are ever any problems,  they have it worked out before I ever arrive. Most places slowed down and had issues since the covid crisis. However, walmart pharmacy, in Gadsden specifically,  somehow improved on their service and I just know that I won't have to worry about anything when it comes to my prescriptions. It is every employee ranging from the pharmacist to the tech and cashier. Thank you! God bless you and your family!

name: Melody Green
text: Very pleased with their service. Have been polite and helpful. Email us when meds are due for refill and pickup. Thank you!

name: kimberlina68
text:
There is no management or guidance of the employees.  They are out of control with rudeness and absolutely zero customer service skills.  With just a little effort, this pharmacy could be great.  Honestly, they think if they are rude, then people will stop coming to the pharmacy and then they could just stand around doing nothing.

10/30/2020
If I could lower it below 1 star, I would.  My medications were ordered and paid for, on the website. This happen 10/23/2020.  Pharmacy was supposed to Fed Ex my 5 prescriptions to my home less than 10 minutes away because I have medical problems driving.  Anyway, I called Tues and was told by Sarah, the meds should be there by Wed 28th. I then called on 29th and was told there was another problem with Fed Ex and they would be there the next day (today).  Well today it is 3 pm and there is no Fed Ex package of my medicines that I need.  I tried to explain this to the Pharmacist, Michelle.  I thought she might be educated and actually have feelings about other people that are going through problems due to their lack of CUSTOMER SERVICE. At the least, they should have called me to explain.  She got very angry and before hanging up, starting yelling “oh my God, I can’t believe...   I just hung up, but I felt like I needed to let her know know she should say stuff like that without hanging up.  I have copies of my medicines being ordered on 10/23/2020 and Fed Ex tracking number being created on 10/26th.  It is 10/30th, and I still don’t have the medicine I need.  I pray no one there ever has to go through what I go through with them.

name: Angel (Angel)
text: I call in a medication at 12:47pm told to pick it up in 1.5 hours.  Go to pick it up and they have no record of me calling to fill it.  Phones are hard to get through.  Total rubish.

text: multiple times didn't fill the prescription and blamed the Doctors.  Multiple times did not refill the needles with the prescription for Insulin sq. Changed to the Wal Mart Pharmacy in Attalla. If I questioned a prescription at the East Gadsden Wal Mart Pharmacy I was treated as if I was bothering them even if they filled the prescription wrong.  I need to add that most of the prescriptions were for other family members and now I've been on hold at the East Gadsden WalMart for 16 minutes waiting to verify a prescription for a terminally ill relative.

They needed  a new perscription because we were out of refills ? And each person wants to blame it on another person and I ask why don't you just call us and tell us that you didn't have it s or you need an authorization ?

Seriously? Very rude

text: Great store, the prices are higher than at some grocery stores but it's like that at every Publix. And like all other Publix stores, they have a huge selection of produce. It's so fresh and pretty. Customer service is really nice at this location.

name: Callie James
text: This pharmacy used to be wonderful. Customer service has gone downhill, and their attitude even worse. They now don't notify you if your doctor denies a refill and requests you contact them to discuss. Apparently, you're supposed to just get annoyed and after a few days miraculously KNOW to call the pharmacy to find this out. Wasted time waiting. Then I told the person I would be moving to a new pharmacy because of this shoddy experience (one of many, but the last straw). She said, "That's fine!" This is where I used to get all of my groceries. Clearly Publix doesn't care. I'm not only moving pharmacies, I will now shop elsewhere for everything. Bye Publix.

name: Kelly Davis
text: Go to pick up a prescription and they are never ready. Always an excuse- sorry, we had to order it, sorry, it didn't come in, sorry, the insurance says it won't refill until tomorrow (after the pharmacy tech TOLD me the refill date). Never a phone call telling me there is a problem. This happens at least twice a month. Sorry, I'll tell my manager. Yeah, right. How about learning to use a phone? Looks like it's time to find a new pharmacy for next year.

name: Shawn Argo
text: My granddaughter needed some medication filled. The pharmacy not only didn’t have it in stock, but didn’t bother to order the medicine since she’s on Medicaid and they said it wasn’t covered, come to find out it IS COVERED and assumed we wouldn’t buy it at cost. In addition they didn’t call to inform us of their decision. My granddaughter has had to suffer because of their incompetence. Never going back to this pharmacy or STORE again! I honestly believe this pharmacy does not have the customers’ best interests at heart and are in it for their own gain. Doctors take an oath to do no harm, guess pharmacists at Publix don’t take an oath!

name: Michael 69
text: Always prompt and very friendly thank you

name: Brittani Miesner
text: Never have I ever had been handled in a timely manner here. The lines are forever long! There are clearly plenty of pharmacy techs around filling prescriptions out. But the drive-thru line is always so long & I normally wait 30-40 mins. I get that it’s a 4-6 o’clock rush, but that’s ridiculous! I don’t bother wasting my time going inside when there have been numerous occasions where they haven’t filled my prescription when they said they would. Or that they have been out of stock & didn’t bother to tell me. If there was a Walgreens nearby my house, I’d switch in a heartbeat!

name: Cheyanne Childress
text: Said my medicine would be ready in 20 minutes came back and said it would be another 30 minutes i swear they are so slow i wouldnt recommend them i would go to target pharmacy or the piggly wiggly pharmacy so much faster and they are nicer these people are rude.

name: Heather Dumdey
text: Worst pharmacy ever. Staff especially the main pharmacist are rude. You go in and they'll ignore you as they carry on their own personal conversations. They mess up on medication. State they cant fill certain prescriptions for whatever reason but I can take them to other places and they fill them just fine. Tonight was my final straw they did not give my daughter all of her medicine and i had to go all the way back up there just to get it fixed. They didnt bother to apologize or anything it was almost as if I inconvenienced them. Go over to mills pharmacy down the street they are way better and always friendly.

name: Seth Alexander
text: Took in my prescription. The lady was a total weirdo about it like I was trying buy something I wasn't prescribed. Refused GoodRX. It was like she kept coming up with excuses not to fill it.

name: Casey Benefield (Think A Little)
text:
So... I was talking to the lady, asking about Vitamin D, whether or not they received the prescription from my doctor, and she flat out hung up on me. I wasn't even arguing, so I have no idea why.

So I mentioned it when I was there in person picking up Synjardy. She just said "oh well, you're here now," and never cared to deal with the prescription Vitamin D...

Seriously, treat some folks with dignity. You can swing a cat and find pharmacies at every corner. I was trying to give Publix another chance after problems back in 2012 (Publix's fault) that landed me in the ER while I waited for them to run a prescription properly. Never received an apology.

Whole staff standing around doing nothing the entire wait only to tell me my child cannot get her medicine. Then refused to send it to another pharmacy...literally the worst people I have ever met. I want them to look my little girl in the eyes and tell her she doesn't deserve her medicine because they assumed she came from a poor family.

text: Absolutely do not use this pharmacy. They do not answer their phones, so I hope you never need to call them with an important question. Last, they are careless on top of not doing their job in that they didn't even enter my full name for my prescription, so that caused problems with notifications for my prescription and who knows if it will cause any problems with insurance. Luckily I caught it soon and had them fix it, so hopefully it won't cause any problems with my insurance. Regardless, I was on the phone waiting for them to pick up the phone for over 15 minutes to avoid a wasted trip to the harmacy, and no such luck.

name: Thomas Pitts
text:
I'm switching pharmacies because the new staff are rude and slightly incompetent. I went into publix during this outbreak ONLY to get my medicines which i had filled over the phone. When I got there, one of my prescriptions didn't have any more refills on it and the pharmacist was very unprofessional and raised her voice at me about not having a doctor and 'it's not her fault' that the refills weren't in. They seem to be unstable individuals and I don't have any faith in whatever Publix is calling this pharmacy. Go somewhere else for quality, local service that you deserve. I am.

Only giving 2 stars bc Publix can fill your prescription at other locations in town. That was useful only ONCE and it was during this outbreak.

name: Mary Harvell
text: I absolutely love this store! It's clean and everyone is so helpful and very kind. Keep up the great work!!

name: J B
text:
Will never go to this pharmacy again after the way I was just treated by the pharmacist on duty. Dark haired caucasian women. From the second I stepped to the window with my prescription paper she gave me attitude. First she started with "we close in 20 minutes." Questioned if my scripts came from the hospital or where they came from. I had just been seen at urgent care on hughes road, as it says on my prescription paper, diagnosed with pneumonia. Then asking me if ive had medications filled there before which i have but its been awhile.  she couldnt find me in the system so that was more attitude like its my fault. How about you do your job and enter me in the system then. The last straw was her getting an attitude with me because I dont have insurance and I use the GoodRX app. I grabbed my prescription paper and left.
Total lack of customer service and manners.

name: Diana Holland Faust
text: They seem to be very efficient and professional at this pharmacy.  And it is nice that they know their customers by sight and by name, even new ones -- not something you see very often.

name: Elizabeth Ludwig
text:
I will never use this location again. I have never taken the time to leave a formal complaint before, but I took the time to bring my experience to the manager’s attention. I have to say I have never felt so belittled or offended by someone in a place where patience and a sense of comfort should be paramount.

I called in a refill of my prescription of simple generic birth control around 2:40pm. I was informed it would be at least an hour. So, when I came by to pick it up at 5:15pm I was surprised to find my prescription was somehow at the downtown location. I was informed by the staff that it would be a 30 minute wait. This was in a clipped exchange where there was no apology or assurance. Unfortunately, my husband had to go back to work so, I told them I would pick it up tomorrow.

Unfortunately, that is not the end of this story. I had time later that evening to go try again around 6pm or so. When I walked back in I actually heard them whisper and groan, “It’s her”. One pharmacist, a tall, thin woman with glasses, exasperatedly began to tell me just how many prescriptions they had to fill that night and how when I said tomorrow mine had been pushed back. This was my prepackaged birth control that they had in stock. I could be wrong but I am fairly certain that it only requires a print out to give it, or at least that's all I have ever seen. I was informed that they could manage it in 15 minutes, and so I waited and inquired about how to move my prescriptions.

So, I waited feeling belittled and absolutely uncomfortable. I decided if I had 15 minutes I would make a complaint to customer service. Once that was done I went on my way, but as soon as I got home and spoke to a friend she too had a series of stories about the tall pharmacist with glasses. What's worse are the reviews I have now read about others experiences. Clearly, this is not a good location in customer service or in quality.

name: Jennifer Day
text: I had foot surgery today and it has been one of the most painful experiences of my life. My husband dropped my pain med script by this pharmacy today and my mother went to pick it up a couple hours later. When she got the medicine home I counted them (because I've always heard you should do this with pain meds). There were supposed to 15 in the bottle and, sure enough, there were only 14. Now I'm super frustrated because I know there is nothing I can do about since my mother didn't count them in front of them. The only thing I thought to do was write a review. Hopefully this help someone else in the future. Do not use this pharmacy! Someone there is likely acting unlawfully and I know I don't want to give them the opportunity to possibly do it again.

name: Carolyna Austin
text: Good staff just like Pinnacle of Providence.

name: Mike Rushlow
text: Clean good customer services nice staffed

name: R R
text: Went into the store looking for crutches for my wife that injured her foot.. granted this was a Saturday, so I’m sure they weren’t expecting much business. As I walked in, there were 2 young girls behind the counter eating lunch. they looked up to see me walk in, and that was the extent of it..  didn’t even acknowledge that I was there with a simple “hello” or “can we help you?”. I walked up to the counter and stood there waiting to be acknowledged so I could ask for assistance, and they just continued to eat and decided I was not worth turning around for.. so after a few moments I decided that this was their customer service at their best and I was just going to have to find it myself.. I finally found the crutches behind me near the entrance (couldn’t see them as I entered the store) as I searched for the right size for my wife, I noticed the size I needed was not marked, but a pair that was in the “adult” slot with no indication of the size.. I finally got there attention by asking “can you tell me what size these are”.. I guess they REALLY weren’t concerned about me when she responded “oh those are $25”. I said “ok.. but what size are these?” She walked over and said “what size do you need?” I told her 5’5 (adult) she looked through them, I guess thinking I was too dumb and hadn’t thought to do the same.. and said “we have some in the warehouse, but it’s closed, but you can come back on Monday and get them”.  I asked what about these that aren’t marked (clearly looking like the size I needed) oh those are the display, again confirming that she could have the crutches for me on Monday. She was never in her reply’s but I felt like I wasn’t worth their time. I’m a RN at a nearby hospital and you can be sure I’ll be more than happy to pass along my experience with this DME store! Wouldn’t recommend!

name: Wendy James
text: Kind and caring service! Kaley went above and beyond to help us with our last minute, emergency needs. We will always, highly recommend these friendly and professional folks!

name: Helen Nixon
text: Well stocked, well supplied and knowledgeable people. Everyone very friendly and helpful. They take the time to make sure you have the right item to fit your needs.

resp.text: Helen, we very much appreciate your kind words.  Glad our team could help meet your needs.   I'll pass on your feedback to our SME team members.  Thank you.

name: William Elliott
text: Absolutely horrible service. I am stuck at a rehab center awaiting delivery of a special walker to go home. I had this ordered 3 days ago. I was promised that it would be here early this morning. Again disappointed. Inquiring again, I was told that it would be delivered when they got around to it. Totally unacceptable. Saad’s has deplorable health services along with a horrible supply company.

resp.text: Mr. Ellliot, we understand the frustration that can come from expectations not met. We have looked into your delivery and found that we first received the order and delivered the equipment within the same morning.  We would appreciate a chance to discuss the matter to understand how we could have helped as we work hard to provide same day home and facility delivery for our customers.

name: Jill Mattson
text: Wheelchair rental was easy and quick. $30 for the week

resp.text:
Thank you for the review and your choice to let us serve you.  We are here to help if you need anything else.

-Phillip

name: John rohman
text: Very helpful, thanks again

name: Nikki TaNecia Hall
text: Great store awesome service. Ryan M. that works there was very nice about helping me find everything I needed. Its like the knew the store intimately even though he just told me he started working there.

name: Justin Hodges
text: Since the opening of this store, Publix Pharmacy on Overton has been my pharmacy.  They are outstanding people.  Thank you for being there.

name: Shelley Jones
text: DO NOT USE THIS PHARMACY. They majorly screwed my prescriptions up (IE giving me the wrong number of pills ) and then tried to cover up a mistake that was made when the prescription was first getting filled. The new pharmacist then claimed that even though I was completely out of my non controlled prescription that I could not get an emergency fill even though they were the reason why I was in that position to begin with.

name: Edward Clayton
text: Out at a  softball game stop by Publix to get Refreshments snacks just enjoy the game

name: Marvin Harris
text:
My parents were provided a hospital bed from this company.  When we discovered the bed wouldn’t raise and lower properly they offered to send a tech out to look at it..for a fee.  My father reached out to them and explained what was wrong as my mother’s home health care providers identified the problem.  I went to the office n person and brought the malfunctioning part; I even sent an email with pictures of the underside of the bed to illustrate the issue. Right now my disabled father is trying to lift my
bed ridden mother out of bed when the home care folks Or one of us isn’t available to transfer her to a chair since the bed won’t raise.  It’s a shame that a company that is supposed to help the elderly is treating  customers so badly.

name: Jurjen Smies
text: My SO needed to rent a mobility scooter while hers was broken down. After a few phone calls, and giving them some time to move the rental scooter from the warehouse to the store, we headed over to see whether the scooter would be suitable. You'd think a business that caters to the needs of the physically disabled would be accessible, but you'd be wrong. The wheelchair accessible door is blocked by various walkers and wheelchairs, so I had to struggle to get my SO, in her wheelchair, through the side door. That was after having to park on the far side of the parking lot, because the disabled parking space that apparently used to be right out front had been erased and was occupied by the business's delivery van. Then it turned out the scooter in question was parked behind the aforementioned walkers and wheelchairs, and once I'd got it out, was not charged and was missing its power cord. The assistant had to place several calls to the manager (who was out making deliveries, presumably with the business's other vehicle) before he returned the call, whereupon we were told that particular scooter was already reserved for another customer. Having thus wasted the better part of an hour, and quite a lot of sweat, we gave up, with a mental note that we would literally try anywhere else before coming here again.

name: Michelle Hancock
text: The ladies that helped me at this place are awesome. I had a situation where I needed my new bipap machine at the last minute due to changes I found out about in my insurance. I was going to have to pay more for my equipment if I did not get it that day. Megan and Savannah hit a home run and were able to squeeze me in and had the exact equipment in store that I wanted! They normally need more than a day to handle new equipment, but told me they were willing to try due to my situation and they really worked hard to make this all happen. I highly recommend using McAbee Medical as their employees really care about their customers.

name: Irfan Rashid
text: Terrible experience. Will not recommend this place to anyone. Purchased a compression stocking for $80 and it ripped 10 minutes later when putting it on. Went back to the store 10 minutes later and they refused to refund or exchange for an identical pair. Not good customer service at all.

name: randee deason
text: Would not recommend, employee seemed stressed and not engaged upon first contact. It was over a month after I heard back from them.

name: Donna Turcotte
text: Wouldn’t fill a stocking prescription without talking to my dr. There was no reason to talk to my dr. Went down the road and had no problems walked out with my stockings. Should have known better by the way they treated my husband when he was alive. Not very nice people.

text: Went to them for a CPAP.  If you want a company that does not return calls, and forces you to track down clinical data while requiring you to also serve as the middle liasion for the Dr and insurance company, this company is for you.  If you want a company to do all this for you and fit and give you your CPAP in a day, go to Southern Medical Equipment in Huntsville.

text: They never have your most needed medicine in stock.  They claim they'll have your seizure meds but don't.  Days go by and they won't get them in from another store.  They let patients suffer instead of getting the meds they need in stock. Ridiculous. Just sad and ridiculous.  God bless them.

name: Courtney Jackson
text: I ordered medicine 5 weeks ago and the head pharmacist said it would be here in a week and so I called every single week to check on it and I was lied to me multiple times by each of the pharmacist there. Then when I went in store they said it was never ordered and I never got a prescription. So the head pharmacist called the doctors office and said it was only referral to get the medicine. (Which would make no sense) and he said he would call me back that day to get the medicine because it was in stock. My doctors office called me and said they sent it to the only pharmacy that had in stock. Not only did they lie to me but my mom also. Plus I'm leaving out of the country and that kind of medicine is nothing to mess with 2 weeks before I leave!! I will not be getting anything else filled here.

name: Jeffery Boak
text: They were very professional and actually went above and beyond to try and get me what I needed at the lowest price. There's nothing worse then poor customer service, so it nice to get excellent service especially when your under the weather.

text: Fast, informative and wonderful peoples ofplecto help you ou.

I will not use them again.  She had no knowledge of insurance and the parameters of PREFERRED vs. NON Preferred pharmacies.  Do yourself a favor and use a PREFERRED mom and pop Pharmacy and support your local community.

text:
🙏💖😇👍FOR ME:  IN EVERY WAY PERFECT!

name: Jacqi Robinson
text: I am so thankful for the nice lady who helped me today at Hinkle pharmacy. I work nearly every day and got by my grandparents today on one of my 2 days off this month to help him since he had just had surgery and he tells me he needs his inhaler re-fill. I go straight to hinkle and the gate is down and I notice they close at 1pm (its 1:20pm) so I drive to the window to look at their hours and a nice lady opens the gate and window and ask how she can help. I proceed to tell her I was looking to see when I needed to get someone to come back for his prescription and she says she can help me and she proceeded to fill my granddad's prescription for me..I cannot tell you how much this meant to me, I care for my grandparents as much as I am able to and for her to go out of her way she has no idea how much she helped me today! I honestly would not have been able to make it back for weeks to get his prescription. I was in tears and am so grateful! Thank you hinkle pharmacy!

text: I've only used Hinkle's once and I had a wondeful experience. I'd recommend this pharmacy to anyone in the local area. Very fast and nice employees.

name: Curtis Armstrong
text:
My experience the last few visits has been to be generally ignored at the counter for a few minutes before being acknowledged, and then a few more minutes before someone helps.
This last time I went to pick up 2 prescriptions.  I had received a text message about an hour and a half before that a prescription was ready, so I assumed they would both be ready.  After I was finally waited on, she only had 1 prescription so I asked about the other one, to which she replied "It hasn't come through".   I thought that was strange as they should have both been ordered from the Dr's office at the same time, but I said I'd go home and call the doctor.  When I arrived home 15 minutes later I received a text stating that I had another prescription ready at the Publix pharmacy, so the order apparently had come through and she either didn't know how to check or didn't bother.
I'm going to look for a better pharmacy.

This is not the first time we have got this medicine and they have to get a prior authority  from insurance to get it. ShI told her what she needed to do and she said oh ok I will put in for it. Today I called and guess the girl just stood in my face and lied because it wasn't done. Will  be so happy when they open the new pharmacy on the Southside as they will definitely  have all our business. I'm done with PubliX and their rude employees.

text: im not giving this any stars it made me check one to post  the dr called in my meds to publix at cottonwood corners about 2 pm today i got to publix about 2.30 and was told it would be about 40 minutes so i said ill be back in a little while to get it i get back at 5.30 pm 3 hours later wait behind 3 other cars for my turn in the drive thur i  was waited on by  Erin H.who ask for my name then walked away and was gone for quite a few mintues when she returned it was to ask me to drive around the building and get back in line as another car was now behind me and i  ask is my meds not ready she we are finishing yours up now so if you will just drive around and come back so i said i left here 3 hours ago being told my meds would be ready in fourty minutes what happened to that she shugged her shoulders and said we got busy and i said ok so if i was was waiting in the parking lot all this time i would still be waiting she said i dont know and i said well im not moving she said well we are working on yours now i said i have a problem with them not being ready after 3 hours she laughed turned off her speaker and walked away so to publix i know losing my business will not make one difference in your pay check you will make the same without my help but it does make a difference to me that i  have a choice to go else where and i plan on doing so tomorrow morning to the people i made wait behind me im sorry it wasnt my choice i would rather my meds been ready after 3 hours  to the young lady who waited on me  you need to practice ypur customer skills or continue to lose publix one  more customer here and there  till it does make a difference and your jobless you may find then  who pays you is the customers and before you laugh and walk away you remember that so with all that being said  i will not take a spot in your drive thur again and i hope publix begins to act like more than a fast food drive thur for the customers they keep

name: Tom McGathen
text:
I did not know I could log into the 180 website.  Every month I was getting an email from 180 asking me to refill my order.  If I wanted to change the numbers or shipping address I called 180.  In January I went to Florida for 5 weeks so I called and asked them to changed the shipping address to Florida. The following month they also shipped them to Florida, so I had to carry them back in my suitcase, leaving some of my clothes behind.
I just found out today March 9 that I could log in and change the shipping address myself,  but don't know if I would have to log in the following month and change the address back.
180 Medical should make more clear how the website works.

resp.text: We're so sorry to hear we didn't communicate that more clearly, Tom. In addition to calling, email, or using our many chat features, the 180 website and Portal for existing customers are great resources for verifying orders and setting changes for personal accounts. We are reviewing our materials to ensure no one using these features will feel lost. Thank you so much for your input. It will help 180 Medical imrpove our systems. Our teams should have reached out to you concerning this issue. Please let us know if there is more we can do. Thanks!

name: Dana Groh
text:
I had been with Woodbury for many years & would recommend their company often. But, since Woodbury has been taken over by 180 it's just not the same. It's been one issue or another. It's very impersonal. And even worse since covid. I'm beginning to feel discriminated against by my daughters status of being medwaiver & medicade. It's been many months since we've received our approved amount of gloves. I was patient @ first understanding the shortage. There's no longer a shortage. I'm seeing gloves for sale all over nowadays. We live on less then $800./mth. If I could afford to buy them we wouldn't need medicade to provide them for caring for my special needs daughter who is total care. She has had MRSA. Gloves are needed for sanitarilly cleaning her during multiple daily diaper changes as well as mouth care multiple times a day. I've even spoken to a 180 manager concerning putting our caregivers @ risk. Yes, the manager sent 2 extra boxes that 1 time. Then right back to shorting us our alloted approved amount. I'm beginning to believe they are holding back our gloves so they can sell them for higher prices to those who can pay for them. I'm beginning to believe they do not care about our situation and only care about the money they can make from other customers. Then this month they don't send the wipes needed for my daughters care & don't even bother to notify us as to why. We'd just go without if I hadn't called them desperate to know where are the wipes? Back order, only choice given was to wait till next month (go without) or accept an insufficient amount of little tiny baby wipes! My daughter is a 29yr old Adult! My impression again is 180 does not care!
Deffinately Not the same company we started with 20 years ago when it was called Woodbury.

resp.text: We are so sorry for any difficulty you and your family have encountered. We have reached out to our teams to get in touch soon to offer some assistance. We know how important these supplies are and certainly want to work through any shortages or mistakes to ensure they are delivered when they are needed.

name: jaime toro
text:
I have had a horrible experience with this company and I’m not one to ever write a bad review unless I really feel like I was done wrong. I work for a nursing home and was pregnant and had to buy new scrub tops and they only had one in stock and had to order another one. So they were both already paid for and I ended up not going back to pick it up right away I went back after I had my baby which was only a few months later that I came back to pick my shirt up that I have paid for already. I was told that I couldn’t get my shirt bc it had already been so long since I bought it and that I also couldn’t get my money back and I was never told ever that I had to pick it up by a certain time or I wouldn’t be able to get it and would lose out on a 34 dollar scrub shirt. I was told well it’s on your  receipt. I’m sorry but not very many people read the small fine print on their receipt so if y’all are going to make such a rule that someone can’t get what they paid for if u don’t pick it up within a certain time it would be nice for that to be told to us before we purchase it. So we can be sure to send someone to pick it up if we can’t make it there. I just think it’s absolutely ridiculous that I am now out 32 dollars for something I had no clue about. So they told me they put my shirt back in inventory which means they resold my shirt and just got double the one for that one shirt. I also called to ask for a manager which they were suppose to have call me and it’s now been over a week and I have yet to hear from a manager.

***UPDATE I never said exactly how many months it had been bc I didn’t know exactly how long it had been but what I don’t understand is that I never was told them I only received a text stating that it was at the store a few times never said I had to pick it up by a certain date and I have a different number now so that may could have been a reason why I may not have gotten anything saying I had to pick it up by a certain time I didn’t think it really matter or would hurt for it to sit there considering it was paid for already but it’s fine it’s a loss Its no big deal I just felt like If y’all send stuff back and are gonna do that u should tell everyone before it is every purchased. And I never spoke to a manager or was never told it was a manager I called back the next day after I went to try and pick it up and was told I’d have someone in contact with me about it and never heard back from anyone. I never said I didn’t get a 20 percent discount that isn’t the point I still paid what I’m required to pay so that discount shouldn’t matter in this situation. But it’s fine I honestly don’t want the shirt anymore i just felt it wasn’t handle professionally and should have been told to me before I ever bought the shirt then I would have been sure to have my mom or husband go get the shirt. I’m sorry I didn’t know one shirt would take up that much room.

resp.text:
I’m the owner and this doesn’t sound right at all.  Let me check into this please.

Hi, I checked into this and found out that you ordered this top in January, 7 months ago and our records indicate several phone calls, text messages and emails to you with no response.  Our last attempt to contact you was at the end of May, 5 months after you ordered and stating we’d hold it another 2 weeks but if you didn’t pickup, it would be sent back to the vendor.  When we send a garment back to the vendor and only because we don’t carry that item in the store and don’t have room; we are charged a 20% restocking fee plus UPS & Fed Ex want pickup for less than $12.  So, restocking fee, shipping charges and employee time spent on your purchase does not equal a double profit but rather a loss.  Plus, you payroll deducted and got a 20% discount.  We work very hard to please our customers.  I also talked to the manager and she spoke with you in person on Saturday.  I personally check my receipt for store return policies before going and specially would look if it had been 7 months.

UPDATE: The owner contacted me and has has agreed to swap the shoes out for me. Im very thankful to her for this. Ive changed my rating to reflect her helping me in this situation. Thank you for taking the time to address my concerns.

name: Kevin Henderson
text: Much love for Medlogic! I arrived in town aaaaaand, sure enough, I forgot my power supply for my CPAP.  I called Medlogic to see if I could purchase a power supply, oh and it was 5 min before closing,  after explaining my situation they said they would wait for me to arrive at their store (huge relief !).  After they found out I was only in town for two days before heading home, they told me I could simply borrow the power supply and return it before leaving town.  I can honestly say that I have experienced customer service like this in such a long, long time! Y'all are such a blessing, and I'm very grateful!

text: After waiting for almost a week for another provider I called Medlogic. Great choice!! I had my new CPAP the same day. Cassandra was great! Knowledgeable and efficient. Can't say enough good things. Highly recommend Medlogic. Thank you !!!!

text: Using Med Logic at UAB Medical West.  Had all of my supplies and so I didn't have to drive down to Hwy 280!  The best part was the personalized service on getting happy with the CPAP which is priceless.  I haven't felt this good in years!  Thank you all so much.  Excellent!

resp.text: Cheryl, thank you for your kind words and for trusting Medlogic with your CPAP therapy.

text: Wonderful place to go for medical supplies. Very professional  friendly and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to take care of you.

name: Gordon Zane
text: Vary sad that was unable to purchase supplies and new head gear from Medlogic. Was wanting to try use a new place and share a new experience . People were very friendly but refused to sell me anything without a prescription. So I left went down to my other choice on Hwy 280 and bought everything I needed without prescription. Spent over $400 dollars that I could of spent at  Medlogic. I still refused to figure out why a business would turn down business when in fact you and order the same products on line🤔. I call my Dr. who said why would you need a scrip when paying cash and it’s not going against your insurance. Apparently someone didn’t ask the right question and assumed it was insurance which you do need a scrip. Sorry for their loss and and business. Reply: You do not need prescription for CPAP supplies, only for MACHINE. READ federal guide lines. Supplies are Not regulated.

resp.text: I would like to thank you for coming in today. Like we explained to you earlier, the masks are a prescription only item. Due to federal regulations, we  must  have a prescription on file to fulfill an order,  even to a private pay customer.  If you look at the package that your mask comes in, you will notice the "Rx only" label .  My apologies if you felt like we didn't want to help you. We just try to follow the rules and do the right thing so that we have longevity in the CPAP world. Our number one priority is always to help with the patient's compliance and achieve a better quality of life via their CPAP therapy.

name: Jennifer Nolan
text: We called and were able to get an appointment the same day.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They also had a great selection of equipment.  I'm so glad we chose them.

resp.text: THANK YOU JENNIFER, IT WAS OUR PLEASURE!

name: Karla Thomas
text: Thank you Medlogic, you are the best!  With Medlogic and Med West sleep clinic working together you both definitely went above and beyond what anyone else could do for me!  My stupid obstructive and central sleep apneas are the hardest and most expensive to treat and you did it inexpensively and quickly!!  You definitely saved my life! Since you weren't an existing patient we had no way of knowing what mask you have. We recommended that you bring in your mask so we could see if we had any parts to accommodate your needs.  If you recall, no pricing was ever discussed because we didn't know what piece you needed.  You stated you had driven a long way and asked where the manager was.  I am in fact the manager and I walked up to the counter when I finished the phone call I was on.  I walked up to intercede and you stated you would not be getting supplies from us but would take our candy out of the candy bowl.  I'm so sorry you felt like you had a less than positive experience. name: Cyndy Dowling
text:
I was pretty much directed to this merchant by my MD. I had a broken bone in my foot. A friend drove me from my MD visit over to this merchant  and I hobbled inside.  I knew I would need to present my insurance information cards and make a payment.

The employee desks are situated at the very back of the room beyond the product displays. "For sale" reclining and lift chairs are located to the left,  then there is a huge group of walkers, wheel chairs, bathing safety seats etc located in the middle section of the store. Neither employee visible got up when we entered the store.

An employee called out something to us from the desk area.

My friend encouraged me to sit in the first reclining chair but as it was a floor product I hesitated to do this and  continued towards the back of the store towards the employees.  One of the employees finally said, "you can sit in one of those chairs".

I AM trying to make a long story short.

I ended up buying a cast boot, but they informed me that they did not take my insurance so I paid out of pocket for the item.

The first boot they tried on me was way too big and they quoted me a price of $89.00 for the item.

In the end they sold me a higher valued, smaller product at close to the price they originally quoted, so I will give them credit for honoring the price they quoted. That is why 2 stars rather than 1 star. (I think the real reason I got the lower price was because my friend advocated for me regarding the price. I could not hear what was said,  because I was still sitting over against the wall in a recliner,  and my friend was over at one of the staff desks.)

The staff did not appear to know or understand their products very well and did not really explain much about the boot I bought. They were not gentle or accommodating of my injured foot which was covered in a sock, but swollen and quite painful. The boot was not put on my foot/leg correctly. The tops of the two rigid metal posts that are covered in a hard, rough, scratchy Velcro product were up above the padding of the boot.  After a bit of struggling by the employees, I really just wanted to finish the process and get out of the store. My foot hurt and nothing they were doing was helping at all.  Later, after I got home,  my husband and I looked at the picture on the cast boot box.  The picture clearly showed the boot padding extending up above the two rigid metal posts.

The posts had already sanded away the skin on both sides of my calf/shin. My husband reassembled the boot correctly and put it back on my foot after putting bandages on the two sores on my calf.

This store needs to rethink the showroom set up. The employees and their desks should be located near the door.  I realize that their product storage and office space are located at the back of the store but they ARE selling medical devices for customers who probably have some kind of limitation. The employees are the ones who should be making the trek across the store. It might also be a good idea for them to have a wheelchair available just inside the door that they could direct a customer to, if needed,  as soon as they entered.  This would be another advantage to the employees being stationed near the door.

Let me be clear. No one was rude to us, but, no one seemed very concerned either. The first girl who tried to help us must have been new and was not familiar with the  boot products.

This necessitated a second, presumably more experienced staff member also assisting us. The second staff member was pretty obviously not pleased that she had to become involved and was very abrupt with the first staff member.

All in all it is not an experience I would repeat.

After I got home and was finally comfortable with the cast boot, I looked up cast boots on Amazon and I could have gotten a comparable or even better product at half the price. And, Amazon has great customer service.

text: I have gone here to fill my prescription the last few months and have always paid roughly $40 for my medication. I go here today and was told that it would be $160. I ran out today, have to work a 10 hour shift in the morning, and I can't work without my medication. So I was basically forced to pay an extra $120. I am fuming. Who does this person think they are to not let someone use something to help them get what they need? This is one of the worst "because I said so" scenarios I've ever encountered. I want a refund of my $120 that was unnecessarily spent and I'm calling in a complaint to corporate. The employees I dealt with were nice and I understand their position, but whoever this manager is needs to reevaluate themselves.

text:
Said they do not accept coupons on "controlled" meds. This is the first time I've run into this issue... Below is an excerpt from goodrx website on the matter.
Pharmacies listed on GoodRx are contractually obligated to honor most coupons we display. However, discounts for controlled substances are honored at the discretion of the individual pharmacy or pharmacist. We are unable to require a pharmacy to fill the prescription or accept the coupon for a controlled medication, but the vast majority of pharmacies will honor coupons for controlled substances, and all pharmacies listed on GoodRx continue to honor GoodRx coupons and discount cards for controlled substances on an individual basis.

So they just choose to take unnecessary money from me and my family. For what reason?

name: Steven Lee
text:
I am not happy. When I bought my Resmed Airsense 10 CPAP they had a VERY limited selection of masks and I'm not happy with the outside vendor mask they had to special order.

Last night my CPAP died middle of the night...repeated attempts to cycle power failed. Had to pull out old CPAP. Showed up at office when they opened, when they plugged it in it worked, but I'm leaving on a trip and don't trust it. The only option they offered was sending it to Resmed...not really an option if you don't have a backup machine. Previous vendor I used just gave me a replacement machine when I had problems.
Bottom line they have VERY limited selection of equipment and no option for loaner or replacement for a critical piece of medical equipment which is still under warranty. I will be changing CPAP vendors immediately.

name: Philip Robinson
text:
A gift for Christmas
Most of us look to give and receive monetary and presents for Christmas.
I too look forward to this, why?, because of the system we've been conditioned too.
Well I received a gift today that beats all those gifts.I Received a gift of friendship

I came to spend Christmas with one of my children . I drove 12 hrs. To get here only to find out at 1130pm. That part of my cpap mask was left at home 12hrs. Away. I went to a late night emergency clinic to find one only to find out they couldn't help. I then went to the emergency room at the closest hospital to find out theirs weren't comparable either. I almost resigned myself to stay up all night fearing to go too sleep.  See sleep Anna is nothing to play with, breathing can stop and kill you so going to sleep is dangerous.

I went on line to see if any of the company's that delt with breathing equipment if they had any emergency after-hours  procedures.God is great. As I glanced through  all the options this one stuck out for the simple reason that they emphasized their care for late-night and emergency needs. My son and I called and left messages hoping that someone would call back.

Their advertisement said that after 12pm that their recording system would call back in the morning. But being it's a holiday I didn't think anyone would.  But by the grace of God around 1210 I was at the hospital emergency room when I got a call. To my surprise the caller wasn't the on call person but one of the owners themselves.

See he took the on-call because the on-call person tested positivefor Cov19 and he decided to not put anyone else on call.  He had never before  been on call. He met me at his office 15 minutes later, gave me a complete upgraded mask for  free. Saying no one should be deprived of a goods night sleep.

So to Michael Harden with ONEAL MEDICAL in Birmingham Alabama, you have given me the best Christmas gift, friendship,commitment,and above all, your word that you would answer anyone who needed help no matter when.

Thanks

resp.text: Thank you Phillip!  All our best and happy holidays sir!

name: Bob Beaty
text:
O'neal has been my CPAP supplier/support go-to for several years. They all are friendly and always helpful. During this "challenging time" the necessary curbside interaction with masking and social distancing is very professional and courteous.  Farah is very knowledgeable and up to date on multiple CPAP systems and the proper accessories.
She quickly re-set my machine's prescription and provided me a status update on my machine.  They are a pleasure to work with.
B
