name: Pete Partin
text: My husband has been on oxygen since 2015.  Since 2017 he has repeatedly asked about a portable concentrater.  Repeatedly he was told that he did not qualify and would not qualify until he had been on oxygen for 5 years.  Now he has a doctors prescription for one but they will not submit it to Medicare because he will be "in the gap" starting in April and they will not be receiving any reimbursement from Medicare, but  would have to continue providing service regardless.

resp.text:
Is your husband a current OXYGEN customer of ONeal Medical because we have no way of knowing based simply on a Google review.

Regardless, a 1 star review is simply not warranted based on the policy of YOUR insurance plan.  We aren't happy about Medicare's policy of paying for oxygen, we hear complaints about it frequently and so do other oxygen companies, but ONeal Medical didn't create the "gap" and Medicare's low payment rates,

Your insurance plan, Medicare, created this mess, not ONeal Medical.

Yes, it is up to our company to provide service for the entire 5 years, yet ONLY get paid for the first 3, and then for 2 whole years (the "gap) basically free of charge. Bear in mind that over this entire 5 year period, we include:
-24 hours service
- maintain the equipment
- free delivery
-all tubing and supplies / filters
-file paperwork on the patient's behalf,
-and from time to time we even provide free oxygen service for patients who travel.

We would be happy to assist once the "gap" period is over, you have the option of privately purchasing a portable oxygen concentrator, but in no way we did we earn a 1 star review as  we feel your review is more a reflection of Medicare's onerous policy, perhaps your misunderstanding of such, but in no way of our company’s performance.

You can call our office and ask to speak to one of the owners for a more detailed explanation if you wish, and you can call 1-800- MEDICARE as well.

The process of getting a portable oxygen concentrator, a fairly complex medical device, is VERY fact dependent, there are significant clinical issues to consider as well, so we would encourage you to contact us again so we can fully explain your options, but a 1 star review, no, that's simply not warranted.

Not at all.

text: I use to LOVE Publix. I moved all prescriptions(around 10+) due to it being closer to home & sooo nice. I even ask if they would fill a prescription from a dr.out of town. Sure, no problem. 6 months + go by & they changed pharmacist. Refuse to fill prescription from out of town. Well I stay at pharmacy because I do love Publix & they have great customer service. I have now been there over a year, ever since they opened. They have changed pharmacy employees again. I call to get my Trelegy (COPD Medicine) filled. Meredith answers. I give her all my info. She said "your prescription expired you will need to call & tell doctor" ok i will Monday, they are closed. She said " We are not going to fill your prescription without an updated prescription on file". I told her I didn't ask her to. I then went to say I need my other, she litterIy hung up, slammed phone down.. i call right back & she answers, i said we got disconnected. she snickers., oh yea, I'm not sure.. I told her i have other meds to fill. I come to pick up four of my meds. I stood over 5-10 minutes. They never saw me. An employee was cleaning the plexiglass & ask how are you today mam loudly so they could hear. A young short hair female walks to counter & says "yea, what's up, what do you want?" The other employee stares at other employee then looks back at me. I tell her I just need to pick meds up, & I give her my name, address, she says sign, then checks me out. She never says anything afterwards. I've NEVER been treated so poorly as I have the last few times. I can give exact days so they can hopefully hear phone conversation if recorded. Decatur Point Mallard. They have been great.

name: Renee Holder
text: One of the worst companies I've ever had the displeasure of working with. Denying a completely  Handicap the right to a bed and wheelchair when she cannot move whatsoever on her own. This company is ridiculous!!!  She has Tricare and Medicare.  And they are worried that they will not get their money?!!! And this is a quote from a representative from their business.  If I could leave 0 stars, I would.

resp.text: Dear Ms. Holder.  I am very sorry you feel that our company is not providing the hospital bed and wheelchair because of being “worried that they will not get their money”.  That is not the main issue in this case, however.  Being paid for the equipment is important to us but most importantly is the medical necessity for the items provided.  Medicare has specific guidelines that we must follow in providing equipment that is ordered and if we do not follow them, not only payment is not received but it opens us up to potential Fraud and Abuse issues with Medicare for billing items that the medical records do not support.  Our Store Manager, myself and another clinical person reviewed the records and documents we have received from the physician’s office who is ordering the equipment and what we have so far, does not show medical necessity for the bed and chair.  We have asked for records that do support it and as of date, not received anything that does.  It is not our desire to withhold needed equipment from anyone who needs it, but we are compelled to follow established guidelines that support it which as of now, not supported by records in our possession.  We would be happy to schedule a meeting with the customer and/or yourself, if you are a designated representative, to provide a copy of the medical necessity requirements and discuss how the records we have compares to the requirements.  Please feel free to contact our local store and let us know when a good time would be.  Again, I am sorry for how you feel but we are not intentionally trying to cause stress for you or the customer.  We are simply following the medical policy established by Medicare.

Somehow you end up leaving feeling like this is your (the customer’s) fault and you should be proud to be in his mere presence, since you haven’t paid for it.  This is brought up every time you conduct business with him. If you don’t want to accept certain insurances, then don’t.  However, no one needs to hear your continuous unprofessional whining.  All of this can be tolerated until I am denied a report being emailed to me that is required for my job and my families livelihood, without paying them first for a report they already agreed to provide....for a report, my report that Jason told me I could call and get with no issues when I received my machine.  This issue has since been elevated through my insurance company and was informed this is not allowed.  In my experience, customer service doesn’t call Deep South Home Medical Equipment home.  However, in the off chance I’ve just had a bad experience with Jason, I’d recommend dropping him like he’s hot and getting someone who is a better fit for what I originally saw as a 5 star reviewed company.

resp.text: Mr. White Snake first off I would like to apologize for your inconvenience and would like to talk to you about this matter at 334-671-9484. Unfortunately, with the ever changing world of healthcare we have had to start charging $10.00 per download for some insurances.

name: Megan Hamm
text: Lie to you and tell you that insurance covers more and then sticks you with the bill. Get from online with prescription. It will save $100s ($1500 vs $499). DO NOT GO HERE FOR CPAP!!!!

name: Danny McLean
text: I have been using Deep South Home Medical Equipment for years and have always been treated with the utmost respect and received my CPAP and supplies timely. Jason always goes above and beyond to get me the product(s) I need. I highly recommend Jason and Deep South HME for all of your CPAP and home medical needs.

name: elvis aaron
text: I have read other reviews that the CPAP department is a myth at deep south, terrible customer service and this I have to agreed with 100%...The very first person u see, that sits at the front desk in the CPAP department when u first walk in, is very rude and sarcastic, to say the least, and the managers or bosses of the CPAP department are jerks...They r all about the money with no real compassion or help with problems that may and will come about during the CPAP experience...We have some great medical supply places here in Dothan and I would suggest u try one of those, cause this is the worse I have ever been treated by any company...thank u....Oh I only gave it one star cause u had to, to post a review, cause they really should get 0 stars...I see 3 other prior customers with very bad reviews, really feel for them, cause no body should b treated so badly ever!!!! I WILL NEVER STEP FOOT IN THIS VERY POORLY RUN PLACE AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!again thanks for reading and so sorry others have been treated terrible as well.....
